title: DOBLEBIT
author: DOBLEBIT
created_time: October 23, 2022, 06:47:17 PMLast edit: January 24, 2023, 01:13:46 PM by DOBLEBIT
content: DOBLEBITA great project that we have been working on for months, where we will be creating fantastic physical bitcoin collectibles for our community that we appreciate so much.When we met our passion for collecting physical bitcoins made us take a big step and venture into the creation of fantastic collectibles, an exciting hobby where every day crazy ideas come to mind.Our first project as DOBLEBIT  is called "FREEDOM" ¬†a fusion of crazy and brilliant ideas, where our mind led us to a mind-blowing design with details that every bitcoin lover will understand and get to the heart.We will explain in detail all our ideas embodied in our creation:A coin with the face of Satoshi Nakamoto, anonymity, freedom, Bitcoin, called "Freedom" likely has a symbolic meaning. It could be interpreted as a representation of the original values and principles of the Bitcoin network, as Satoshi Nakamoto is the pseudonym used by the anonymous creator(s) of Bitcoin. The anonymity aspect of the coin may also be a nod to the decentralized and private nature of Bitcoin transactions. The word "Freedom" could refer to the decentralized and permissionless nature of Bitcoin, which allows for financial transactions without the need for intermediaries such as banks or governments. Overall, this coin likely represents a belief in the power of decentralized and anonymous digital currencies to promote financial freedom and autonomy.We welcome suggestions

comments.author: PreciousMetapsICT
comments.body: I prefer funded for small amounts and limited mintage. Also first bits on holo along with a serial so mintage can be trackedMy opinion anyways but agree DIY seem to never get built when I have them

comments.author: DOBLEBIT
comments.body: awesome, thank you very much for the comments.did you like the design? We accept criticism and suggestions to improve future creations.Today is a very special day for us. Thank you.

comments.author: Bullion-n-BTC
comments.body: For smaller amounts like .001 btc I prefer loaded as even if I DO get scammed it‚Äôs not a huge loss (though I‚Äôd rather not be). For the larger denoms like .005 btc and up I like a diy version UNLESS it‚Äôs from a proven, reputable source. For a newer creator diy versions are great

comments.author: Bullion-n-BTC
comments.body: Also idk if you‚Äôre taking requests but I‚Äôll take 2

comments.author: meser#
comments.body: I love it. But the anonymous style bitcoin mask remind me transformers  But if i had to choose i'll say second option. The hologram might be fancy but security is mine priority. If I understood the question correctly, this is my answer

comments.author: markinaz
comments.body: I would be interested in one (depending on the price), and I prefer loaded since it has a denomination.¬† I really like what Lealana does with the distinction between the loaded and unloaded (Buyer Funded), kind of makes the loaded ones more valuable (IMHO) even if someone loads the buyer funded ones later.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: Markzellers on October 24, 2022, 03:21:20 AMI would be interested in one (depending on the price), and I prefer loaded since it has a denomination.¬† I really like what Lealana does with the distinction between the loaded and unloaded (Buyer Funded), kind of makes the loaded ones more valuable (IMHO) even if someone loads the buyer funded ones later.in reality though all Lealana's are buyer funded. The difference is funded prior to shipment by the buyer or funded after receipt by the buyer - either way still funded by the buyer directly. Smoothie never has access to the funds outside of the key generation.

comments.author: Mbitr
comments.body: Love the design¬† DIY gets my vote - I think for all future coin makers, it‚Äôs got to be DIY for trust and security reasons - no offence.Well done on the creation of the coin, I can see a lot of hard work has gone into it

comments.author: markinaz
comments.created_time: October 24, 2022, 01:47:57 PMLast edit: October 24, 2022, 01:58:51 PM by Markzellers
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on October 24, 2022, 04:04:39 AMQuote from: Markzellers on October 24, 2022, 03:21:20 AMI would be interested in one (depending on the price), and I prefer loaded since it has a denomination. ¬†I really like what Lealana does with the distinction between the loaded and unloaded (Buyer Funded), kind of makes the loaded ones more valuable (IMHO) even if someone loads the buyer funded ones later.in reality though all Lealana's are buyer funded. The difference is funded prior to shipment by the buyer or funded after receipt by the buyer - either way still funded by the buyer directly. Smoothie never has access to the funds outside of the key generation.Agreed completely on your comments! ¬†I guess what I am insinuating is that this design does not currently show the public key, unless that will be visible on the hologram (or a portion and or a reference to a website that would provide the whole key). ¬†What I like about Smoothie's approach is you can identify which are loaded when shipped (loaded directly by the buyer), vs. those that may or may not be loaded (need to verify, and I do like how Smoothie has the public address etched on the coin itself).¬† This also ensures that all coins look the same, if there is a window for the key to show on the hologram, I could see many variations if people print their own keys, etc.Again, I really like Smoothie's approach.Thanks!Mark

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: Markzellers on October 24, 2022, 01:47:57 PMQuote from: MoparMiningLLC on October 24, 2022, 04:04:39 AMQuote from: Markzellers on October 24, 2022, 03:21:20 AMI would be interested in one (depending on the price), and I prefer loaded since it has a denomination.¬† I really like what Lealana does with the distinction between the loaded and unloaded (Buyer Funded), kind of makes the loaded ones more valuable (IMHO) even if someone loads the buyer funded ones later.in reality though all Lealana's are buyer funded. The difference is funded prior to shipment by the buyer or funded after receipt by the buyer - either way still funded by the buyer directly. Smoothie never has access to the funds outside of the key generation.Agreed completely on your comments!¬† I guess what I am insinuating is that this design does not currently show the public key, unless that will be visible on the hologram (or a portion and or a reference to a website that would provide the whole key).¬† What I like about Smoothie's approach is you can identify which are loaded when shipped (loaded directly by the buyer), vs. those that may or may not be loaded (need to verify, and I do like how Smoothie has the public address etched on the coin itself).Again, I really like Smoothie's approach.Thanks!MarkWith how easy it is to remove holograms and get keys and then to replace the holos - it will always boil down to whether you trust everyone who has had the coin - and even those without the ‚Äúbuyer funded‚Äù holo should still be verified.

comments.author: DOBLEBIT
comments.body: Hello colleagues, I see a diversity of opinions, but I would like more members of the forum to participate and obtain their opinion.
